questions: Thanks for participating in our survey about events on Austin parkland! What is your home zip code?

Are you (1) an event attendee, (2) resident who lives near a park where events are held, or (3) involved with producing an event on Austin parkland? If you are more than one of these, please indicate all that apply
If you have attended an event at an Austin park, which one or ones have you attended?
What would you say is the most significant benefit from events on Austin parkland (like ACL)?
What would you say is the most significant challenge created by the events on Austin parkland?
What, if anything, would you recommend change about events that take place at Austin city parks?

Thanks for your feedback! If you’d like to share more, visit atxtalks.org to find a conversation on this topic near you!  You can also visit austintexas.gov/petf for information on the Parkland Events Task Force discussions on this issue
Thanks for your text! What questions do you have about the Police Department's draft policy for body cameras?
Thanks! We will work to get you a response as quickly as possible. For more information, visit austintexas.gov/police

Thanks for your PB idea for D38! Your idea has been added to our database and every idea is reviewed by the budget delegates. To assist in that process txt “DELEGATE” and we’ll send you info on how to sign up as a delegate! You can txt in more ideas until Nov 14th
Thanks for txting Concilmatic! We can connect you and your ideas to your City Councilmember. What ideas or questions do you have about your neighborhood?
Thanks!  Txt back for updates or check www.councilmatic.org for live legislation tracking, meeting schedules, and bill progress.

textResponses.firstTexter: Thank you for messaging HeartGov! Please ask me a question, if you'd like to discuss a particular subject, please include the number like this: (1).

stories.title: Cortelyou Road Radio Station
stories.content: Heartgov allows a way for people and organizations to voice their questions and ideas about the neighborhood.

stories.title: NationSwell
stories.content: For those that don't have Internet access, this tool connects residents and leaders.

stories.title: Tech President
stories.content: In Brooklyn, testing a text platform that connects locals, representatives, and community leaders.

questions.label: Partners
questions.content: State Senator Jesse Hamilton - 20th Senate District

questions.label: What can I text in?
questions.content: Anything about your neighborhood: is there a street corner you think need a stop sign? Or an empty lot you think should have a park? How do you feel about stop and frisk? How do you feel about charter schools? Have you ever sat around and told your friends, "if they just listened to my idea, everything would be so much better!" Well, now you have that chance.

questions.label: What does it cost?
questions.content: There is no sign up fee, but normal text message rates apply.

questions.label: Can I help spread the word?
questions.content: Absolutely! Tell your friends and neighbors. If you would like post cards or stickers to hand out, send us an email and someone will follow up with you to drop some off.
